body: This file is supplied together with the training dataset, and is not created by any script in the MXNet repo.  You can find out about the origin of the `synset.txt` here: http://image-net.org/challenges/LSVRC/2015/browse-synsets

are there any remaining blockers for merging https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/5133 ?
@piiswrong test passed. Please merge. Thanks!

It may be sensible to do inside `Makefile` across all projects 

```
$(CXX) $(CFLAGS) $(ADD_CFLAGS) ....
```

and give `ADD_CFLAGS=$(ADD_CFLAGS)` as parameter to all sub-`make`s.

What do you think?
Can we merge this so @kevinthesun can reconfigure his nightly jobs to clean up workspaces?
merged. Thanks!

There are  a number of errors in your command:

(1) Please change `--launcher=yarn` to `--launcher yarn`.
(2) Remove `-H $DEEPLEARNING_WORKERS_PATH`. Note that `-H` is for ssh or mpi not yarn.
(3) If you have built jar through `build.bat`, put it in your working dir, or configure it using ` --yarn-app-dir $your working dir`.

You can find more information in `launch.py` and `yarn.py`.

No, I have not. @zht3344

Although @dytan 's method is invalid for me, we can confirm that this problem is about gcc version conflict between system and Anaconda2(or 3). More concretely spearking, gcc version of current system(Ubuntu 16.04, 64bit) is 5.4 which support GOMP protocol 4.0, and MXNet compiling is achieved by gcc5.4. Anaconda2(or 3) uses gcc4.8 compiling which support GOMP protocol 3.0.

After I tried below commands, it's okay to import mxnet in Ubuntu Shell:
```shell
yuens@Spark:~/Software/mxnet/example/ssd$ sudo ln -sf /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgomp.so.1 /usr/local/lib/anaconda2/lib/libgomp.so.1.0.0
yuens@Spark:~/Software/mxnet/example/ssd$ sudo ln -sf /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgomp.so.1 /usr/local/lib/anaconda2/pkgs/libgcc-4.8.5-2/lib/libgomp.so.1.0.0
yuens@Spark:~/Software/mxnet/example/ssd$ sudo ln -sf /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 /usr/local/lib/anaconda2/pkgs/libgcc-4.8.5-2/lib/libstdc++.so.6
yuens@Spark:~/Software/mxnet/example/ssd$ sudo ln -sf /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 /usr/local/lib/anaconda2/lib/libstdc++.so.6yuens@Spark:~/Software/mxnet/example/ssd$ python
Python 2.7.13 |Anaconda 4.3.0 (64-bit)| (default, Dec 20 2016, 23:09:15) 
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-1)] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
Anaconda is brought to you by Continuum Analytics.
Please check out: http://continuum.io/thanks and https://anaconda.org
>>> import mxnet
>>> exit()
```
At a word, you should make four soft link:
```shell
# libgomp.so
ln -sf /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgomp.so.1 /opt/anaconda3/lib/libgomp.so.1.0.0
ln -sf /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgomp.so.1 /opt/anaconda3/pkgs/libgcc-4.8.5-2/lib/libgomp.so.1.0.0

# libstdc++.so
ln -sf /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 /opt/anaconda3/pkgs/libgcc-4.8.5-2/lib/libstdc++.so.6
ln -sf /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 /opt/anaconda3/lib/libstdc++.so.6
```
In each `ln -sf` shell command, front directory is in system, later directory is in Anaconda(**You should look up where is your anaconda directory firstly**).

Thanks to this [link](http://www.jianshu.com/p/e1b10ead6966?hmsr=toutiao.io&utm_medium=toutiao.io&utm_source=toutiao.io) in MXNet compiling part!

@antinucleon Do you have a fastpoor model trained using recent version of MXNet?  Unfortunately the old saved parameters doesn't seem to work correctly with recent MXNet amalgamation version.  Would you be able to provide the training script if you haven't had the chance to train it recently?  Thanks.
@howard0su Thank you very much!

@zwx8981
### generate lst  

To generate list ,you can try following command:
```
python im2rec.py --recursive=True --list=True prefix root
```  
the args need `prefix` and `root`, `prefix` is where you wanna generate .lst file, `root` is your path of your dataset  

### generate rec  

After you generate lst file successfully, you can run the command to generate rec:  

```
python im2rec.py [-h] [--list LIST] [--exts EXTS] [--chunks CHUNKS]
                 [--train-ratio TRAIN_RATIO] [--test-ratio TEST_RATIO]
                 [--recursive RECURSIVE] [--shuffle SHUFFLE]
                 [--pass-through PASS_THROUGH] [--resize RESIZE]
                 [--center-crop CENTER_CROP] [--quality QUALITY]
                 [--num-thread NUM_THREAD] [--color {-1,0,1}]
                 [--encoding {.jpg,.png}] [--pack-label PACK_LABEL]
                 prefix root
```  

there are also `prefix` and `root`, they are same as above I talk
@saicoco Thank you for your explanation! Now I get correct .lst and .rec files, but when I run the mx.io.ImageRecordIter function, an unknown error happens and python.exe stop working....
Are you compile mxnet with `USE_OPENCV=1` in file config.mk? If `USE_OPENCV=0` , `mx.io.ImageRecordIter` will raise error about opencv

It's alright, you can read it detail when you run it next time in cmd, the error when you run program in ipython will be output in cmd, I guss the error related to opencv

Could you be more specific on whats wrong with the A3C implementation?
The parameters are the same for all buckets. The symbol you loaded is actually the one with max bucket_key. So try with the mod.

Hi @piiswrong, 1. [A3C](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/tree/master/example/reinforcement-learning/a3c) is actually parallel actor critic, since it uses batch learning instead of asynchronous learning. 2. As noeted in "Policy Gradient Theorem", in policy gradient, the loss is: , which just considers the action taken, so the policy output should be SoftmaxActivation(with advantage as out_gradient) instead of SoftmaxOutput. 3. I think the entropy loss in [A3C](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/tree/master/example/reinforcement-learning/a3c) is not right, please refer to [parallel_actor_critic/model.py#L30](https://github.com/loofahcus/mxnet/blob/parallel_actor_critic/example/reinforcement-learning/parallel_actor_critic/model.py#L30)

Hey, I meet the same problem.
```
pure virtual method called
terminate called without an active exception

```
I crosscompile mxnet with openblas and opencv using arm-hisiv400-linux-g++ and create libmxnet.so successfully.
Then I make a test.cpp.
```
#include <mxnet/ndarray.h>
int main(int argc, char const *argv[]) {
  auto ctx = mxnet::Context::CPU();
  std::initializer_list<mxnet::index_t> init = {256, 3, 256, 256};
  mxnet::TShape size(init);
  mxnet::NDArray test = mxnet::NDArray(size, ctx);  // if comment this line, no error
  return 0;
}
```
and compile with
```
 /opt/hisi-linux/x86-arm/arm-hisiv400-linux/bin/arm-hisiv400-linux-gnueabi-g++ test.cpp -o test -std=c++11 -fopenmp  -I. -L/opt/hisi-linux/x86-arm/arm-hisiv400-linux/lib_mxnet -lmxnet -lopenblas -lz -lopencv_core -lopencv_imgproc -lopencv_imgcodecs -lgomp -DMSHADOW_USE_MKL=0 -DMSHADOW_USE_CUDA=0 -DMSHADOW_USE_SSE=0 -DMKL_EXPERIMENTAL=0
```
**test** is created successfully without any error. But when I run it on embedded target, this error occurs.
```
pure virtual method called
terminate called without an active exception
Aborted
```
But when I comment "mxnet::NDArray test = mxnet::NDArray(size, ctx)"; , it runs well.

Besides, if I use g++ on my computer(ubuntu14.04-x64), this **test** runs well also.

So I wonder if there is some setting I ignore when using cross compiling mxnet. 

Much thanks.

@loofahcus It's really great if we can get the A3C implementation correct! Have you tried it on other games like BreakOut? Also, I think that SoftmaxActivation with advantage as the out_grad should be the same as SoftmaxOutput with the advantage as the label. And A3C in the original paper should be asynchronous, which uses different exploring ratio for the agents.
I think it's a good example for parallel actor critic.
